etymologies: late 16th century; earliest use found in Arthur Golding (d. 1606), translator. From post-classical Latin informitat-, informitas shapelessness, formlessness (late 2nd or early 3rd century in Tertullian), deformity, ugliness from classical Latin informis + -tās

definitions: The condition of being unformed, shapelessness; misshapenness, deformity.
